memberdef.argsstring: ()=default
memberdef.name: cublasFlowCapturer

briefdescription.para: constructs a cublas flow capturer
gets the native cublas handle associated with this cublasFlowCapturer

simplesect.para: a native cublas handle of type cublasHandle_t

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t n, const T *h, int inch, T *d, int incd)
memberdef.name: vset

briefdescription.para: copies vector data from host to device

detaileddescription.para: This method copies n elements from a vector h in host memory space to a vector d in GPU memory space. The storage spacing between consecutive elements is given by inch for the source vector h and by incd for the destination vector d.
This method calls native cublasSetVectorAsync with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
number of elements
target device pointer
spacing between consecutive elements in d
source host pointer
spacing between consecutive elements in h

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t n, const T *d, int incd, T *h, int inch)
memberdef.name: vget

briefdescription.para: copies vector data from device to host

detaileddescription.para: This method copies n elements from a vector d in GPU memory space to a vector h in host memory space. The storage spacing between consecutive elements is given by inch for the target vector h and by incd for the source vector d.
This method calls native cublasGetVectorAsync with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
number of elements
target host pointer
spacing between consecutive elements in h
source device pointer
spacing between consecutive elements in d

memberdef.argsstring: (int n, const T *x, int incx, int *result)
memberdef.name: amax

parameterdescription.para: data type
number of elements in vector x
pointer to the memory address of the vector
stride between consecutive elements of x
the resulting index (1-based indexing)

briefdescription.para: finds the sum of absolute values of the elements over a vector

detaileddescription.para: This method calls native cublas<t>asum with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

memberdef.argsstring: (int n, const T *alpha, const T *x, int incx, T *y, int incy)
memberdef.name: axpy

briefdescription.para: multiples a vector by a scalar and adds it to a vector

detaileddescription.para: This function multiplies the vector x by the scalar alpha and adds it to the vector y overwriting the latest vector with the result. Hence, the performed operation is:
y[j] = alpha * x[k] + y[j],
where j and k are indices of n elements with step sizes incy and incx.
This method calls native cublas<t>asum with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
number of elements in vectors x and y
scalar used to multiplication
pointer to the memory address of the vector x
stride between consecutive elements of x
pointer to the memory address of the vector y
stride between consecutive elements of y

memberdef.argsstring: (int n, const T *x, int incx, T *y, int incy)
memberdef.name: vcopy

briefdescription.para: copies a vector to another vector

detaileddescription.para: This function copies n elements from a vector x of a step size incx to another vector y of step size incy.
adds it to the vector y overwriting the latest vector with the result. Hence, the performed operation is:
y[j] = x[k],
where j and k are indices of n elements with step sizes incy and incx.
This method calls native cublas<t>copy with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
number of elements to copy
pointer to the memory address of the vector x
stride between consecutive elements of x
pointer to the memory address of the vector y
stride between consecutive elements of y

memberdef.argsstring: (int n, const T *x, int incx, const T *y, int incy, T *result)

pointer to the memory address of the vector x
stride between consecutive elements of x
pointer to the memory address of the vector y
stride between consecutive elements of y
the resulting dot product

briefdescription.para: swaps elements between two vectors

detaileddescription.para: This function interchanges the elements of vectors x and y. Hence, the performed operation is:
where j is the index of element in y with a step size incy and k is the index of element in x with a step size incx.
This method calls native cublas<t>swap with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

memberdef.name: gemv

briefdescription.para: performs matrix-vector multiplication

detaileddescription.para: This function performs matrix-vector multiplication:
y = alpha * op(A) * x + beta * y,
where alpha and beta are scalars, A is a 2D matrix stored in column-major format, and x, y are vectors.
The input matrices are in column-major storage.
This method calls native cublas<t>gemv with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
transport operation op(A)
number of rows of matrix A
number of columns of matrix A
pointer to the alpha scalar
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix A
pointer to the address of x of at least (1 + (n - 1) * abs(incx)) elements if no transposition, or (1 + (m - 1) * abs(incx)) elements otherwise.
stride between consecutive elements of x
pointer to the beta scalar
pointer to the address of y
stride between consecutive elements of y

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasOperation_t trans, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *x, int incx, const T *beta, T *y, int incy)

memberdef.name: syr

briefdescription.para: performs symmetric rank-1 update

detaileddescription.para: This function performs symmetric rank-1 update:
A = alpha * x * x^T + A,
where alpha is a scalar, A is a 2D symmetric matrix stored in column-major format, and x is a vector.
The result is also symmetric and is stored on in the uplo part of A.
This method calls native cublas<t>syr with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix A lower or upper part is stored, the other symmetric part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements
number of rows and columns of matrix A
pointer to the alpha scalar
pointer to the address of x
stride between consecutive elements of x
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix A

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, int n, const T *alpha, const T *x, int incx, T *A, int lda)

memberdef.name: syr2

briefdescription.para: performs symmetric rank-2 update

detaileddescription.para: This function performs symmetric rank-2 update:
A = alpha * x * y^T + y * x^T + A,
where alpha is a scalar, A is a 2D symmetric matrix stored in column-major format, and x and y are vectors.
The result is also symmetric and is stored on in the uplo part of A.
This method calls native cublas<t>syr2 with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix A lower or upper part is stored, the other symmetric part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements
number of rows and columns of matrix A
pointer to the alpha scalar
pointer to the address of x
stride between consecutive elements of x
pointer to the address of y
stride between consecutive elements of y
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix A

memberdef.name: trmv

briefdescription.para: performs the triangular matrix-vector multiplication

detaileddescription.para: This method performs the triangular matrix-vector multiplication:
x = op(A),
where A is a triangular matrix stored in lower or upper mode with or without the main diagonal, and x is a vector.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix A lower or upper part is stored, the other part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements
transpose operation op(A)
indicates if the elements on the main diagonal of matrix A are unity (i.e., all 1s) and of no need to be accessed
number of rows and columns of matrix A
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of 2D array used to store matrix A
input of vector b and output of the solution on exit
stride between consecutive elements of x

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, cublasDiagType_t diag, int n, const T *A, int lda, T *x, int incx)

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::trmv but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, cublasDiagType_t diag, int n, const T *A, int lda, T *x, int incx)
memberdef.name: trsv

briefdescription.para: solves the triangular linear system with a single right-hand-side

detaileddescription.para: This method solves the triangular linear system with a single right-hand-side
op(A) x = b,
where A is a triangular matrix stored in lower or upper mode with or without the main diagonal, and x and b are vectors.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix A lower or upper part is stored, the other part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements
transpose operation op(A)
indicates if the elements on the main diagonal of matrix A are unity (i.e., all 1s) and of no need to be accessed
number of rows and columns of matrix A
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of 2D array used to store matrix A
input of vector b and output of the solution on exit
stride between consecutive elements of x

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, cublasDiagType_t diag, int n, const T *A, int lda, T *x, int incx)
memberdef.name: c_trsv

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::trsv but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasOperation_t ta, cublasOperation_t tb, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *beta, const T *B, int ldb, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: geam

briefdescription.para: performs matrix-matrix addition and transposition

detaileddescription.para: This method performs the matrix-matrix addition/transposition:
C = alpha * op(A) + beta * op(B),
where alpha and beta are scalars, and A, B and C are matrices stored in column-major format with dimensions op(A) as m by n, op(B) as m by n and C as m by n, respectively.
The operation is out-of-place if C does not overlap A or B.
The in-place mode supports the following two operations:
For in-place mode, if C equals A, ldc equals lda and ta equals CUBLAS_OP_N. If C equals B, ldc equals ldb and tb equals CUBLAS_OP_N.
The operation includes the following special cases:

listitem.para: the user can reset matrix C to zero by setting alpha and beta to 0
the user can transpose matrix A by setting alpha to 1 and beta to 0

detaileddescription.para: The input matrices are in column-major storage.
This method calls native cublas<t>geam with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
transport operation op(A)
transport operation op(B)
number of rows of matrix C and op(A)
number of columns of matrix C and op(B)
pointer to the alpha scalar
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix A
pointer to the beta scalar
pointer to the address of B
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix B
pointer to the address of C
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix C

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasOperation_t ta, cublasOperation_t tb, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *beta, const T *B, int ldb, T *C, int ldc)

memberdef.name: gemm

briefdescription.para: performs matrix-matrix multiplication

detaileddescription.para: This function performs matrix-matrix multiplication:
C = alpha * op (A) * op (B) + beta * C,
where alpha and beta are scalars, and A, B, and C are 2D matrices stored in column-major format with dimension op(A) as m by k, dimension op(B) as k by n, and C as m by n.
The input matrices are in column-major storage.
This method calls native cublas<t>gemm with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
transport operation op(A)
transport operation op(B)
number of rows of matrix C and op(A)
number of columns of matrix C and op(B)
number of columns of op(A) and rows of op(B)
pointer to the alpha scalar
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix A
pointer to the address of B
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix B
pointer to the beta scalar
pointer to the address of C
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix C

memberdef.name: c_gemm

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::gemm but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasOperation_t ta, cublasOperation_t tb, int m, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A[], int lda, const T *B[], int ldb, const T *beta, T *C[], int ldc, int bc)
memberdef.name: gemm_batched

briefdescription.para: performs matrix-matrix multiplication over a batch of matrices

detaileddescription.para: The batch must be uniform. All instances in the batch must have the same dimensions (m, n, k), leading dimensions (lda, ldb, ldc) and transpositions (ta, tb) for their respective A, B and C matrices. The address of the input matrices and the output matrix of each instance of the batch are read from arrays of pointers passed to the function by the caller.
C[i]= alpha * op (A[i]) * op (B[i]) + beta * C[i], i in [0, bc),
where alpha and beta are scalars, and A[i], B[i], and C[i] are 2D matrices stored in column-major format with dimension op(A) as m by k, dimension op(B) as k by n, and C as m by n.
The input matrices are in column-major storage.
This method calls native cublas<t>gemmBatched with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
transport operation op(A[i])
transport operation op(B[i])
number of rows of matrix C[i] and op(A[i])
number of columns of matrix C[i] and op(B[i])
number of columns of op(A[i]) and rows of op(B[i])
pointer to the alpha scalar
array pointer to A batch
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix A[i]
array pointer to B batch
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix B[i]
pointer to the beta scalar
array pointer to C batch
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix C[i]
batch size (number of matrices)

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasOperation_t ta, cublasOperation_t tb, int m, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A[], int lda, const T *B[], int ldb, const T *beta, T *C[], int ldc, int bc)
memberdef.name: c_gemm_batched

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::gemm_batched but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasOperation_t ta, cublasOperation_t tb, int m, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, long long int sA, const T *B, int ldb, long long int sB, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc, long long int sC, int bc)
memberdef.name: gemm_sbatched

briefdescription.para: performs matrix-matrix multiplication over a batch of matrices with strided memory access

detaileddescription.para: Here, we use A[i], B[i], C[i] as notation for A, B and C matrices in the i-th instance of the batch, implicitly assuming they are respectively address offsets sA, sB, sC away from A[i-1], B[i-1], C[i-1].
The input matrices are in column-major storage.
This method calls native cublas<t>gemmStridedBatched with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

T
data type
ta
transport operation op(A[i])
tb
transport operation op(B[i])
m
number of rows of matrix C[i] and op(A[i])
n
number of columns of matrix C[i] and op(B[i])
k
number of columns of op(A[i]) and rows of op(B[i])
alpha
pointer to the alpha scalar
A
pointer to A batch
lda
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix A[i]
sA
address offset between A[i] and A[i+1]
B
pointer to B batch
ldb
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix B[i]
sB
address offset between B[i] and B[i+1]
beta
pointer to the beta scalar
C
pointer to C batch
ldc
leading dimension of 2D array used to store the matrix C[i]
sC
address offset between C[i] and C[i+1]
bc
batch size (number of matrices)
a tf::cudaTask handle
The batch must be uniform. All instances in the batch must have the same dimensions (m, n, k), leading dimensions (lda, ldb, ldc) and transpositions (ta, tb) for their respective A, B and C matrices. Input matrices A, B and output matrix C for each instance of the batch are located at fixed address offsets from their locations in the previous instance. Pointers to A, B and C matrices for the first instance are passed to the function by the user along with the address offsets - sA, sB and sC that determine the locations of input and output matrices in future instances.
C + i*sC = alpha * op (A + i*sA) * op (B + i*sB) + beta * (C + i*sC), i in [0, bc),
where alpha and beta are scalars, and A[i], B[i], and C[i] are 2D matrices stored in column-major format with dimension op(A) as m by k, dimension op(B) as k by n, and C as m by n.
On certain problem sizes, it might be advantageous to create multiple gemm tasks to take advantage of concurrent kernels, rather than this method.

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasOperation_t ta, cublasOperation_t tb, int m, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, long long int sA, const T *B, int ldb, long long int sB, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc, long long int sC, int bc)
memberdef.name: c_gemm_sbatched

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::c_gemm_sbatched but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasSideMode_t side, cublasFillMode_t uplo, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: symm

briefdescription.para: performs the symmetric matrix-matrix multiplication

detaileddescription.para: The method performs symmetric matrix-matrix multiplication:
C = alpha * A * B + beta * C, if side == CUBLAS_SIDE_LEFT, or
C = alpha * B * A + beta * C, if side == CUBLAS_SIDE_RIGHT.
A is a symmetric matrix stored in lower or upper mode, B and C are m by n matrices, and alpha and beta are scalars.
This method calls native cublas<t>symm with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix A is on the left or right of B.
indicates if matrix A lower or upper part is stored, the other symmetric part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements.
number of rows of matrix C and B, with matrix A sized accordingly
number of columns of matrix C and B, with matrix A sized accordingly
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of matrix A
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store A
pointer to the address of matrix B
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store B
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of matrix C
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store C

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasSideMode_t side, cublasFillMode_t uplo, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: c_symm

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::symm but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: syrk

briefdescription.para: performs the symmetric rank-k update

detaileddescription.para: This method performs the symmetric rank-k update :
C = alpha * op(A) * op(A)^T + beta * C,
where alpha and beta are scalars, C is a symmetric matrix stored in lower or upper mode, and A is a matrix with dimension op(A) n by k.
The result is stored to uplo part of C.
This method calls native cublas<t>syrk with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix C lower or upper part is stored, the other symmetric part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements.
transposition operation to apply to A
number of rows of matrix C and op(A)
number of columns of matrix op(A)
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store A
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of C
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store C

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: c_syrk

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::c_syrk but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: syr2k

briefdescription.para: performs the symmetric rank-2k update

detaileddescription.para: This method performs the symmetric rank-2k update :
C = alpha * (op(A) * op(B)^T + op(B) * op(A)^T) + beta * C,
where alpha and beta are scalars, C is a symmetric matrix stored in lower or upper mode, and A and B are two matrices with dimensions op(A) and op(B) n by k.
The result is stored to uplo part of C.
This method calls native cublas<t>syr2k with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix C lower or upper part is stored, the other symmetric part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements.
transposition operation to apply to A
number of rows of matrix C and op(A)
number of columns of matrix op(A)
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store A
pointer to the address of B
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store B
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of C
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store C

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: c_syr2k

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::syr2k but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: syrkx

briefdescription.para: performs a variation of the symmetric rank-k update

detaileddescription.para: This method performs a variation of the symmetric rank-k update:
C = alpha * op(A) * op(B)^T + beta * C,
where alpha and beta are scalars, C is a symmetric matrix stored in lower or upper mode, and A and B are two matrices with dimensions op(A) and op(B) n by k.
The result is stored to uplo part of C.
This method calls native cublas<t>syr2k with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if matrix C lower or upper part is stored, the other symmetric part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements.
transposition operation to apply to A
number of rows of matrix C and op(A)
number of columns of matrix op(A)
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of A
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store A
pointer to the address of B
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store B
scalar used for multiplication
pointer to the address of C
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store C

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, int n, int k, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, const T *beta, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: c_syrkx

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::syrkx but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasSideMode_t side, cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, cublasDiagType_t diag, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: trmm

briefdescription.para: performs triangular matrix-matrix multiplication

detaileddescription.para: This method performs triangular matrix-matrix multiplication:
C = alpha * op(A) * B, if side == CUBLAS_SIDE_LEFT, or
C = alpha * B * op(A), if side == CUBLAS_SIDE_RIGHT,
where A is a triangular matrix stored in lower or upper mode with or without the main diagonal, B and C are m by n matrix, and alpha is a scalar.
This method calls native cublas<t>trmm with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

T
data type
side
indicates if matrix A is on the left or right of B
uplo
indicates if matrix A lower or upper part is stored, the other part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements
tran
transposition operation to apply to A
diag
indicates if the elements on the main diagonal of matrix A are unity and should not be accessed.
m
number of rows of matrix B, with matrix A sized accordingly
n
number of columns of matrix B, with matrix A sized accordingly
alpha
scalar used for multiplication
A
pointer to the address of matrix A
lda
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store A
B
pointer to the address of matrix B
ldb
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store B
C
pointer to the address of matrix C
ldc
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store C
Notice that in this method, B and C can point to the same address in which case the in-place implementation is performed (with results written back to B).

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasSideMode_t side, cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, cublasDiagType_t diag, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, const T *B, int ldb, T *C, int ldc)
memberdef.name: c_trmm

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::trmm but oeprates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasSideMode_t side, cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, cublasDiagType_t diag, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, T *B, int ldb)
memberdef.name: trsm

briefdescription.para: solves the triangular linear system with multiple right-hand-sides

detaileddescription.para: This method solves the triangular linear system with multiple right-hand-sides:
op(A) * X = alpha * B, if side == CUBLAS_SIDE_LEFT, or
X * op(A) = alpha * B, if side == CUBLAS_SIDE_RIGHT,
where A is a triangular matrix stored in lower or upper mode with or without the main diagonal, X and B are m by n matrices, and alpha is a scalar.
The solution X overwrites the right-hand-sides B on exit.
This method calls native cublas<t>trsm with packed parameters, (handle, args...), where handle is managed by the cublasFlowCapturer and args... are the given arguments.

parameterdescription.para: data type
indicates if A is on the left or right side of X
indicates if matrix A lower or upper part is stored, the other part is not referenced and is inferred from the stored elements
transposition operation to apply to A
indicates if the elements on the main diagonal of matrix A are unity and should not be accessed
number of rows in matrix B, with matrix A sized accordingly
number of columns in matrix B, with matrix A sized accordingly
scalar to apply to B
pointer to the address of matrix A
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store A
pointer to the address of matrix B
leading dimension of the 2D array used to store B

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasSideMode_t side, cublasFillMode_t uplo, cublasOperation_t tran, cublasDiagType_t diag, int m, int n, const T *alpha, const T *A, int lda, T *B, int ldb)
memberdef.name: c_trsm

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::cublasFlowCapturer::trsm but operates on C-styled row-major layout

memberdef.argsstring: (cudaStream_t)
memberdef.name: _stream

briefdescription.para: class to construct a cuBLAS task graph

detaileddescription.para: cublasFlowCapturer provides a higher-level interface over the cuBLAS library and hide concurrency details from users. It inherits methods from tf::cudaFlowCapturerBase and must be used from a tf::cudaFlowCapturer object. All pointers used to cublasFlowCapturer methods must be in GPU memory space or managed (i.e., cudaMallocManaged), including scalars, alpha and beta, input data and output data pointers. The following example uses cublas<t>amax to find the minimum index of the element of the maximum absolute magnitude in a vector.
Currently, cublasFlowCapturer supports only float and double data types.
We design most tf::cublasFlowCapturer methods on top of the native, high-performance cuBLAS library. You may refer to cuBLAS for more details.
